message: I catch up to Noiz a little ways from the entrance. He's walking at a brisk pace.
I look up at him, thinking to give him a piece of my mind, but something else catches my eye.
...What was that? I could have sworn I saw something in the shadows over there.
Something white from head to toe, like a ghost...
I look again, but there's nothing there.
...When I turn back around, Noiz has vanished.
I walk around briskly, searching the area until I find him standing in front of a food stand on a street lined with similar shops.
Right. He said something about being hungry.
I approach, calling his name, and he turns around.
He's holding what looks like a tray of takoyaki. He already got something?
Noiz turns back to the line of shops. He moves to the next one and buys something else.
This repeats with the next shop in line, and the next, and the next...

name: 蒼葉
message: "How much food does one person need?!"
In no time at all, Noiz has stuffed his arms full of food. It looks like he might drop something at any moment.

name: 蒼葉
message: "You can't carry all that. Give me some."
I can't stand to watch anymore, so I run up to him and take some of the food off his hands.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I didn't mean it like that... Come on, you bought way too much."

name: ノイズ
message: "If you're worried about money, I've got plenty."

name: ノイズ
message: "I deal Rhyme intel. There's tons of people willing to pay top dollar for my gang's intel. We're almost never wrong about where Usui's gonna show."
I remember him mentioning something like that.
But I don't understand why anyone would spend money to get information about a game.
Noiz points at the takoyaki I'm holding. His expression is sincere.

name: ノイズ
message: "Yeah, but I dunno what they're called."
I scowl at him, thinking he has to be messing with me, but there isn't a hint of mischief on his face.
His eyes are full of curiosity.

name: ノイズ
message: "I'm not fucking kidding. Just tell me what they're called."
Noiz shows me a wrapped item he's holding.
I look into Noiz's eyes, but I still can't tell if he's messing with me or not.
I mean, I know he's a little weird, but how does he not know foods that basically everyone eats in the Old Residential District?
Noiz looks at the crepe and the churro, then takes a bite out of the churro.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Glad you like it... but what the hell have you been eating all this time?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Wouldn't you normally get bored of that?"

name: ノイズ
message: "Nah. I'd eat the same thing every day, as long as it's good."
A little weird doesn't cut it for this guy.
Suddenly feeling tired, I pop a takoyaki into my mouth.
It's delicious. I must have been hungrier than I knew.
Still, I'm surprised Platinum Jail has such "low-class" food. I thought it was all fancy restaurants and stuff.

name: 蒼葉
message: "They even have taiyaki... I'm kinda impressed."
While I'm looking at the other shops, something suddenly grabs my arm.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Of course it is. What are you, twelve? How old are you anyway?"
I'd already guessed he was younger than me, but I thought he was at least twenty...
Actually, is this why I find him so weird? The age difference?
He's so calm and collected on the outside, but on the inside...
Wait. So some punk-ass kid's been messing with me this whole time?!
That's when I notice the words on the digital billboards peppered around town.
Isn't that the event Granny told me about?
I take off running, wondering if this is how it feels to be a parent.
